phrases.text: Hò là hò lên ta ơi ơ hò
phrases.english: call out is/be call out go up I/we oh oh call out

culturalContext.description: As part of a Hò kéo (hauling songs - heavy labor coordination), this phrase would have been sung during communal labor to coordinate physical movements and maintain work rhythm. As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice throughout Central and Southern Vietnam
The call-and-response structure kept workers in rhythm and made hard labor more bearable
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Opening phrases in Vietnamese folk songs often use vocatives (ơi, này) to grab attention before the narrative begins
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout. Exclamatory phrases often use sustained notes or melismatic ornaments (grace notes, bends) to heighten emotional intensity. In hò work songs, this phrase would be sung in strong rhythm synchronized with physical labor movements.

phrases.text: Hò lên cho gỗ ta về ơ hơ hơ hơ ơ hơ ơ Xem lên trời trời cao mà lồng lộng ơ ơ ơ hơ ơ ơ ơ hơ Ngó xuống dưới đất đất rộng trông mà mênh mông

culturalContext.description: "Ông" is a respectful address for married men. Its use in this context shows the formal politeness maintained in Vietnamese, even when criticizing one's husband. As part of a Hò kéo (hauling songs - heavy labor coordination), this phrase would have been sung during communal labor to coordinate physical movements and maintain work rhythm.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice throughout Central and Southern Vietnam
The call-and-response structure kept workers in rhythm and made hard labor more bearable
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
culturalContext.musicalContext: In hò work songs, this phrase would be sung in strong rhythm synchronized with physical labor movements.

phrases.text: Trăm a năm mình duyên thắm a tình nồng
phrases.english: hundred (vocative) five oneself fate deep (color) (vocative) love/feelings strong (smell/flavor)

culturalContext.description: This phrase invokes "duyên" (fate/destiny), a Buddhist concept deeply embedded in Vietnamese views on relationships. Vietnamese believe marriages are predetermined by karma from past lives. As part of a Hò kéo (hauling songs - heavy labor coordination), this phrase would have been sung during communal labor to coordinate physical movements and maintain work rhythm.
facts: Vietnamese distinguish "duyên" (destined connection) from "tình" (feeling/love) - you can have duyên without tình and vice versa
"Duyên trời định, tình tự trao" (Fate is heaven-ordained, feelings we bestow ourselves) is a common Vietnamese saying
Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice throughout Central and Southern Vietnam
The call-and-response structure kept workers in rhythm and made hard labor more bearable
culturalContext.musicalContext: Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative. In hò work songs, this phrase would be sung in strong rhythm synchronized with physical labor movements.

phrases.text: Lòng chung thủy thề rằng mà sắt đá hơ
phrases.english: heart/inside together/common thủy [?] thề [?] Rang (name) that/which iron stone warm/roast

culturalContext.description: As part of a Hò kéo (hauling songs - heavy labor coordination), this phrase would have been sung during communal labor to coordinate physical movements and maintain work rhythm. As the closing phrase, this provides resolution and often returns to opening themes for circular structure.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice throughout Central and Southern Vietnam
The call-and-response structure kept workers in rhythm and made hard labor more bearable
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure. In hò work songs, this phrase would be sung in strong rhythm synchronized with physical labor movements.
